title: Greater Manchester crash: Two dead after Vauxhall Astra hits road sign
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Two men have died following a crash close to Bury in Greater Manchester.

The tragedy happened at 1.30am in Whitefield.

The Vauxhall Astra hit a road sign before colliding with a nearby wall, investigators said this morning.

One of the victims died at the scene, while the second was pronounced dead in hospital a short time later.

Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.

(Image: ASP)

A statement from Greater Manchester Police said: "A silver Vauxhall Astra had collided with a road sign, resulting in the car hitting a nearby wall.

"There were two men in the car, one man sadly died at the scene.

(Image: ASP)

"The second man was taken to hospital and despite the best efforts of emergency staff, was also sadly pronounced dead a short time later."

We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story.
description: The tragedy happened at 1.30am, Greater Manchester Police said
